decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures and disrupting opponents with instant speed spells. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can cheat out creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to control the board and protect its combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control spells, creating a fast and flexible gameplay experience.

This deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to quickly overwhelm opponents, while also incorporating control elements to disrupt their strategies. The Eldrazi Temple land allows for early plays of powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return provide removal and utility, while cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Ground Seal offer graveyard hate. Ugin's Labyrinth can slow down aggro decks, and cards like Malevolent Rumble provide additional board control. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early and then ramp into devastating Eldrazi threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls, while also having removal options like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to strengthen your board presence and protect your creatures. Overall, this deck aims to efficiently deal damage and control the board to secure a fast victory.

The main theme of this deck is to focus on control elements, utilizing a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells to dominate the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Psychic Frog to apply pressure on the opponent. The land base is designed to ensure consistency and provide access to various colors of mana. By effectively disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining board control, this Dimir Control deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with a combination of aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, backed up by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck also includes control elements like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to disrupt your opponent's strategy. With a mix of versatile creatures and spells, along with a solid mana base, this deck aims to win the game through fast and aggressive plays while also having some control elements to handle opposing threats.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent through a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to dismantle the opponent's game plan by denying key cards and resources while gradually building card advantage and establishing board control. By efficiently managing threats and resources, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately winning through attrition and incremental advantage. The deck emphasizes adaptability and strategic decision-making to navigate different matchups and scenarios effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the game and keep the opponent's resources in check. It plays a mix of powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk, coupled with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. With cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also has some flicker effects to generate additional value from creatures like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly and cast high-impact threats and spells. By assembling Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower, the deck can generate an abundance of mana to play game-changing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. With Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny, along with disruptive spells like Warping Wail and Kozilek's Command, this deck seeks to dominate the board and outvalue opponents in the late game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures early on to apply pressure on the opponent. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco to quickly deal damage and control the board. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to protect your creatures and maintain board control. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional removal and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, removal, and control elements.

The key concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, draw cards and eventually win the game through card advantage and powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Solitude. Additionally, the inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional synergies and benefits for the control strategy, making the deck more versatile and resilient against different matchups.

The deck focuses on assembling a wide variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful synergies and combos. It uses creatures like Samwise Gamgee, Cauldron Familiar, and Gilded Goose along with tools like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures when needed. The toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility and adaptability in different situations. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Sephiroth, Fabled SOLDIER provides additional utility and protection. Overall, the deck aims to create explosive sequences and overwhelm the opponent with a diverse array of threats.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while controlling the board with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells and card draw to maintain a consistent hand size and keep the opponent on the back foot. The mana base is designed to maximize consistency and ensure that the deck can cast its spells effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the powerful equipment Colossus Hammer onto Ornithopter or Inkmoth Nexus, enabling fast and explosive attacks. By utilizing Stoneforge Mystic and Puresteel Paladin to search for and equip the necessary pieces, the deck can often win the game in just a few turns. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provides additional search and utility options to streamline the combo. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive, unblockable threat early in the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield through reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's resources and maintain the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Archon of Cruelty, while also having the ability to disrupt their game plan with cards like Raucous Theater and Thought Scour.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats on the board. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes various fetch lands and utility lands. The goal of the deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy, draw cards with Narset and Lrien Revealed, and eventually win through card advantage and powerful finishers like Hall of Storm Giants and Monumental Henge.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. It also includes cards that provide additional benefits based on having multiple colors of mana in play. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and direct damage spells, while also utilizing support cards to protect its key threats and maintain board control.
